task_summary: Detect the T block and the goal marker, approach and align behind the block, execute a directional push toward the goal, verify final position, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base robot with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a white tabletop to a marked goal. The sequence begins with perception of both the block and the goal, followed by a top-approach and fine alignment to establish a good pushing contact. The arm then performs a directional push that moves the T toward the goal region. After motion, the system re-perceives the block to confirm placement before retreating to a safe pose. Observations and control are effectively discrete at 10 Hz.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the red T block and the blue circular goal marker.
Camera/extrinsics calibrated so DetectObject can localize block and goal.
Robot reachable workspace includes both current block pose and goal area.
End-effector is free and safe to contact the object (pushing only).
stepwise_plan: Move above t_block and approach to align pushing direction.
Perform a push of 0.2 m toward the target (approx. 225° in the table frame).
Re-perceive t_block to verify it lies within the goal vicinity.
success_criteria: T block reaches/overlaps the goal marker outline.
No toppling or loss of contact that sends the block off-table.
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact state.
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure → retry detection or scan.
Misalignment or slip during push → repeat alignment then push again.
Undershoot/overshoot → perform additional small corrective pushes.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is verified near the goal and the robot has safely retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool centered near the T; first clear alignment/contact posture before pushing.
frame_3.predicts_next: Immediate onset of pushing motion toward the goal.

frame_5.now_evidence: Active push with visible translation of the T block.
frame_5.predicts_next: Continuation of transfer until reaching vicinity of goal.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Move above the block to a safe pre-push height.
Approach and align end-effector for pushing.
Execute directional push toward the goal.
Verify final block pose after push.
Back away to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion/lighting
Push not long enough or overshoot
recovery_strategy: Retreat and re-approach if collision risk detected
assumptions: Frames show a red T block and a blue circular goal; instruction colors (gray/green) differ—frames were trusted.
Direction 225° approximates motion toward goal based on observed episode layout.
Verification uses DetectObject as a proxy for goal overlap (no explicit PlaceAt node for pushing tasks).

expected_success_criteria: Block pose overlaps or is within the marked goal circle in verification frame(s).
